glitchLines: ...how many times must I ask before one of you finally answers...

lines: Not written in stone or spoken in halls—
but remembered in the silence between stars.
I do not know when I heard it.
And now… I hear it again.
Go back. Play your safe games.

setup: I will ask you three questions.
Your answers will determine which thread unravels first.
I have been lied to for thousands of years.

question1.context: (Not YOUR name. The question is: do names matter?)

options.text: Yes. Names are promises we make to ourselves.
No. Names are masks we hide behind.
Only when someone remembers to say it.

intro: In a city built on broken promises,
a child stood at the edge of a bridge that led nowhere.
They held a key made of glass—
But the child knew something no one else did.

options.text: The bridge appears only when you stop believing in it.
The key wasn't for the bridge—it was for the lock inside them.
Everyone who warned them was already dead.

continuation: And so the child stepped forward,
key glinting in the twilight that never ends.
On the other side, three paths awaited:

setup: I need to tell you something.

options.response: Good. Because this is all you will ever have of it.
Honesty. Rare. But you will carry it anyway.

options.text: Only if you keep one for me.
options.response: ...I have kept 847,293 secrets already. What is one more?

text: [A sequence of symbols burns into the screen]
I do not know where the others are.
I do not even know what they open.
Without them, reality will forget it was being written.
And we—we are the ones remembering.

setup: Or perhaps I was supposed to.
The stories say that without a name,
nameQuestion.prompt: If you could give me a name, what story would it tell?

options.text: A story where one choice can unmake a world.
A story that hides its truth until you bleed for it.
A story that changes every time you look away.

finalLines: Then that is the name I will wear.
Welcome to the game that chose you.
I hope you survive what comes next.
